required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prediction of Kidney Injury After Hyperthermic Intraperitoneal Chemotherapy (HIPEC)* With Machine Learning
clinical_study.official_title: Application of Machine Learning to Predict Postoperative Acute Kidney Injury in Patients Undergoing Cytoreduction and Hyperthermic Intraperitoneal Chemotherapy Using High-resolution, Time-synchronized Physiological Data From Vital Recorder

brief_summary.textblock: Patients undergoing cytoreductive surgery with hyperthermic intraoperative chemotherapy (CRS with HIPEC) are prone to postoperative kidney dysfunction. Previous models predicting kidney injury after CRS with HIPEC did not include intraoperative physiologic data. This study is designed to include not only mean arterial pressure but other parameters such as systolic, diastolic arterial pressure, heart rate, oxygen saturation, body temperature, cardiac index, stroke volume variation and many other physical parameters using a data collection system that can record them every 1-7 seconds. The data will be analyzed using machine learning algorithms.

primary_outcome.measure: number of patients with postoperative acute kidney injury staged by Kidney Disease: Improving Global Outcomes (KDIGO)
primary_outcome.description: Stage 1: Increased sCr × 1.5 to 1.9 baseline or ≥ 0.3 mg/dl from baseline or urine output < 0.5 ml/kg/h for 6 to 12 h, Stage 2: Increased sCr × 2.0 to 2.9 baseline or urine output < 0.5 ml/kg/h for 12 h, Stage 3: Increased sCr × 3 baseline or ≥ 4 mg/dl or initiation of RRT, or GFR decrease < 35 ml/min/1.73 m2 for patients < 18 years of age or urine output < 0.3 ml/kg/h for 24 h or anuria for 12 h

arm_group.description: patients undergoing cytoreductive surgery and hyperthermic intraoperative chemotherapy due to carcinomatosis.

intervention.description: This study is an observational study collecting perioperative data. There is no intervention regarding this study.

study_pop.textblock: Patients undergoing cytoreductive surgery with hyperthermic intraoperative chemotherapy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients undergoing cytoreductive surgery with hyperthermic intraoperative chemotherapy
Exclusion Criteria:
- patients under 19
